result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:50 AM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Benoy   Defendant Kevin Douglas Henderson in court.  Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney James S Robbins in court for Kevin Douglas Henderson.  DF wishes to waive the preliminary hearing. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Court confirms address. Bond continues.  Adjourned:  9:55
Arraignment scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 066914,
Payable Number: 242893,
Receipt Number: 22R 009906,
Amount: $20.00

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, A.M. W. or with any minors under age of 18 unless supervised.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- Defendant to have baseline test before released. 

- I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

- If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:21 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Kevin Douglas Henderson. Defendant Kevin Douglas Henderson in court, in custody. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  ADA Becker states he believes Atty Robins will take this case. DE confirms address.  Court orders bond. Orders parties to contact JA to schedule next hearing. bph
